Visualize the syllable la above the pupils of the two eyes, slightly bend the head, focus the mind, and visualize a full moon disc between the breasts. Arrange the five syllables above the moon disc;
Visualize the syllable a in the center, like the color of gold, and the other four syllables are arranged clockwise.
The true meaning of the five syllables is:
The syllable a means all dharmas are originally unborn;
The syllable va means the meaning of thought cannot be obtained through verbal expression;
The syllable ra means all dharmas are free from defilements;
The syllable ha means the cause of all dharmas cannot be obtained;
The syllable kha is all like empty space, which cannot be obtained.
This is called mental recitation.

Form the samadhi mudra and place it on the crown of the head, recite three times, and imagine sending off the holy assembly.

Rise from paying homage to the Buddha, walk as one wishes, read and recite the Mahayana Vaipulya sutras, dedicate the merit to all sentient beings, vow to quickly fulfill the mind's wishes, and accomplish worldly and transcendent siddhis.
